RESUBMITTAL INFORMATION

The Risk Management Plan (RMP) for the INDSPEC Chemical Plant in Petrolia, PA has been updated and is being resubmitted in March, 2009 due to the revision of the accident history in section 6 of the site's RMP to include information on a chemical release that occurred on October 11, 2008. No other accident history information had appeared in the previous version of the RMP as no other accidents had occurred in the past five years. The INDSPEC Chemical Plant is a facility reporting under Program 3 and the RMP has also been revised to include the incident investigation information in section 7. Specifically, the date of investigation and the expected date of completion of changes to reflect actions taken as a result of the accident have been revised.

The information which is included regarding the release which occurred on October 11, 2008 is based upon INDSPEC?s investigation to date and includes information on claims which have been submitted to INDSPEC.  In regard to such claims, INDSPEC has not currently undergone a complete investigation to determine the claims? validity.


EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The INDSPEC Chemical Corporation facility at Petrolia, PA is a producer of industrial chemicals.  INDSPEC Chemical Corporation is a wholly owned subsidiary of Occidental Petroleum Corporation.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Stationary Source (? 68.155(a))

INDSPEC Chemical Corporation has established a system for the safe operation of the processes at this facility that includes the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances.  One component of this system is a program to manage the risks of accidental releases at the Petrolia, PA facility.  This program conforms to the requirements of the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA's) regulation 40 CFR part 68, Accidental Release Prevention Requirement Risk Management Programs (the RMP rule) and requirements of OSHA 1910.119.  This document is intende

d to satisfy the RMP plan requirement of the RMP rule and to provide the public with a description of the risk management program at the Petrolia, PA facility.

The Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled (? 68.155(b))

The INDSPEC Chemical Corporation Petrolia, PA facility consists of a chemical production plant that is wholly owned by Occidental Petroleum Corporation.  INDSPEC Chemical Corporation operates the plant at the site.  The facility handles 3 substances that are regulated by the RMP rule.  These substances are as follows:

OLEUM, ETHYL ETHER, FORMALDEHYDE

The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Specific Prevention Steps (? 68.155(d))

The Petrolia, PA  facility?s prevention program has been prepared so that it conforms to both the OSHA Process Safety Management and the EPA Risk Management Plan regulations.  The program consists of the following elements:

Process Safety Information,Process Hazard Analysis,Operating Procedures,
Training,Mechanical Integrity,Management of Change,
Pre-Startup Review,Compliance Audits,Incident Investigation,
Employee Participation,Key Procedures,Contractor Safety Program

Each of the items listed above are documented and maintained in manuals at the facility.  These manuals are routinely updated.

Five-year Accident History (? 68.155(e))

The INDSPEC Petrolia Plant has had one accidental release during the past five years which meets the criteria for an accidental release per 40 CFR 68.42.  An incident on 10/11/08 as outlined in Section 6 resulted in the release of 3300 pounds of sulfuric acid mist, equivalent to 2826 pounds of Oleum.

Emergency Response Program (? 68.155(f))

The Petrolia, PA facility has established a written emergency response plan and maintains an emergency response team (?ERT?) trained in these emergency response procedures.  All plant personnel are trained in evacuation procedures and in-plant drills are conducted periodically.  The drills are used to test the response tim

e of the Emergency Response Team, to test the plant employee accountability program, and to activate the plant's Emergency Command Center (?ECC?).  In addition, the Petrolia, PA facility has developed a Special Situations Plan (?SSP?) which is a program designed for responding to emergencies that may have impacts beyond the immediate plant and is a supplement to the Emergency Response Plan.  The Special Situation Plan links the local response to the OxyChem Corporate Emergency Response Center located in Dallas, Texas.

The facility supports the efforts of the Butler County Local Emergency Planning Committee (?LEPC?), which includes industrial and public entities.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety (? 68.155(g))

The Petrolia, PA facility constantly tries to improve the safety of the processes through annual reviews of our plant procedures, near misses and incident investigation programs, and a program soliciting safety and environmental suggestions from the plant employees.

Certification Statement

To the best of the undersigned's knowledge, information, and belief formed after reasonable inquiry, the information submitted is true, accurate, and complete.
